column13: ParkCity Medical Centre and Bukit Tinggi Medical Centre organised a year-long Bring Your Own Bottle and Container campaign to encourage our people, doctors, patients and guests to cut down on single-use plastics. column13: In the past year, Ramsay has saved 24 million single-use plastic items such as cutlery, medicine cups and kidney dishes from landfills by sourcing more environmentally friendly alternatives. column13: Clinical excellence is fundamental to our business and demands constant focus. Across all regions, clinical governance frameworks and programs are designed to foster continual improvement. We continue to demonstrate high-quality outcomes.

column13: Protecting privacy is a crucial commitment to our patients. Each region has dedicated data protection and privacy officers (or equivalent) responsible for delivering privacy training to our people. This year, Ramsay UK and Elysium achieved the UK Government-backed Cyber Essentials Assurance Standard, and more than 1,000 Ramsay Sime Darby employees were trained to uphold privacy and personal data protection. The number of notifiable privacy breaches has remained low across our regions.
column20: Protecting Privacy, Data Protection, Privacy Breaches
column24: Ramsay Health Care Impact Report - Final - 2023

column13: Hospital accreditation is an essential and severe process in all our facilities. We must maintain high quality and safety standards to pass stringent audit processes set by relevant jurisdictional authorities. We also undertake thorough review processes to ensure our doctors and visiting medical officers have appropriate credentials and operate within their allowed scope of work. FY23 accreditation highlights include: Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 100% accreditation maintained Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 99% of Ramsay SantÃÂ© clinics certified A or B (V2014) or high-quality care and confirmed quality care Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 97% of Ramsay UK achieved a Ã¢ÂÂGoodÃ¢ÂÂ rating by Care Quality Commission Ã¢ÂÂ¢ 12% of ElysiumÃ¢ÂÂs rated sites achieved Ã¢ÂÂOutstandingÃ¢ÂÂ and 65% achieved Ã¢ÂÂGoodÃ¢ÂÂ under the Care Quality Commission Ã¢ÂÂ¢ Gold standard accreditation awarded to six Ramsay Sime Darby hospitals from the Joint Commission International (JCI).

column13: Taking care of our employees enables them to better care for our patients, colleagues and communities. That is why we promote better physical and mental well-being for everyone. We have trained over 500 people in Mental Health First Aid in Australia and the UK. The skills-based, early intervention training program equips participants with the knowledge and confidence to recognise, connect and respond to someone experiencing a mental health problem or mental health crisis. Feedback from participants has been positive.\t
